app.title: Sprite Sheet Animation Previewer
app.upload_prompt: Click to Upload or Drag & Drop Sprite Sheet

guide.title: Sprite Sheet Specs Guide
guide.description: When developing 2D games or web animations, the frame count and playback speed of a Sprite Sheet directly affect visual smoothness and performance balance.
guide.walk_desc: Shows complete stepping and center of gravity shifts.
guide.run_desc: Faster cycle, fewer frames create a sense of speed.
guide.attack_desc: Includes details of anticipation, strike, and recovery.
guide.fx_desc: Explosions, smoke, or flashes need more frames for smoothness.
guide.fps_retro_desc: Strong choppy feel, suitable for classic pixel art.
guide.fps_cinema_desc: Most natural visual feel, choice for most hand-drawn animations.
guide.fps_game_desc: Provides extremely smooth visual experience, suitable for fast-paced action.
guide.equal_sizing_desc: Frame W/H must be consistent. Ex: 1024x1024, 16 frames = 256x256 each.
guide.keyframes_first_desc: Draw start, apex, and impact points first, then fill in-betweens.
guide.looping_desc: Ensure the last frame transitions smoothly back to the first.
guide.padding_desc: Leave 1~2px transparent space around character to prevent bleeding.
